SENT.plain: A case of fatal butane gas poisoning in a young female is presented
Quantitative toxicological analysis showed that the concentration of butane in the femoral blood was 6.8 microl/ml, and isobutane and propane were also identified
Severe congestion of the lungs and deposition of lipofuscin in the myocardium were also observed
We concluded that the cause of death of the victim was due to cardiac arrhythmia induced by the butane gas abuse
